_header: Here beginneth the sooth to say / A noble book with out nay
Note: For the other MSS see 5398 and 5399; for an abridged and altered text see 788.
Bibliographic Ghosts:
London, British Library Arundel 57: Begins at line 802 according to Lewis (1981)
XLewis, R. E. “The relationship of the Vernon and Simeon texts of the Pricke of Conscience.” So meny people longages and tonges: philolgical essays in Scots and mediaeval English Presented to Angus McIntosh. Ed. Michael Bensking and M. L. Samuels. Edinburgh, 1981. 251-64.
_description: The Pricke of Conscience with ten prefatory lines prefixed to the usual beginning

BodDou156.First Lines:
HEre bigynneþ þe soþ to sayA noble book wiþ out
                    nay …
BodDou156.Last Lines:
…þe fire þere is of siche pousteeþat hit may
                    neuer slakis be
BodDou156.Attributed Title:
At the begining: ‘Ihesus assit principo sancta Maria meo’. Ends
                    imperfectly because of the loss of folios.

RylandsEng50.Transcription:
H[ ]eth þe [ ]A nobil book wiþoute [ ]The w[ ] is cald
                    of [ ]To [ ]nful þt her e [ ]
RylandsEng50.Note: First page badly damaged from damp.
RylandsEng50.Attributed Title:
Stimulus Concientie (added top, f. 1, partly cropped); The Prologe
                    (rubric)

Holkham668.First Lines:
Here bygynneþ [ ]All bel book [ ]Þe whiche is cald
                    of confessioun…
Holkham668.Last Lines:
…To þe whiche place he us alle bryngeÞat for oure [
                    ] on roode con [ ]
Holkham668.Note:
Unnumbered folios; dirt obscures some text on folio 1 and again on folio
                        ultv.
